definition: to pick a quarrel/to start a fight

sentences.english: Avoid loud and aggressive persons, they are vexatious to the spirit.
sentences.chinese: 避開喧鬧尋釁者，他們會擾人心神。

sentences.english: John picked a fight with Jack and came off worst.
sentences.chinese: 約翰尋釁和傑克打架，結果大喫苦頭。

sentences.english: During these states, sufferers will sometimes pick fights at random and then hide underground.
sentences.chinese: 在這狀態下，患者會時不時的尋釁，然後躲起來。

sentences.english: Some people get aggressive after drinking spirits.
sentences.chinese: 有些人酒後愛尋釁惹事。

sentences.english: Would wainwright find some way to retaliate within the bank ?
sentences.chinese: 溫賴特會不會在銀行內部尋釁報復呢？

sentences.english: Jim often gets into fights because he goes about with a chip on his shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆經常同人打架，因爲他整天都是一副尋釁的樣子。

sentences.english: The children bantered him for a fight.
The man became belligerent when he drank too much beer.
sentences.chinese: 這個男人喝多了啤酒之後就變得愛尋釁滋事。

sentences.english: Blade wheel was belligerent passengers by the Japanese patrolled boat hit.
sentences.chinese: 刀鋒所乘客輪被尋釁的日軍巡查艇擊中。

definition: to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to make sth difficult/to create obstacles
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
to love ease and comfort and hate work (idiom)
variant of 輾轉|辗转[zhan3 zhuan3]
